item.description:
This is one in a series of presentations that Phillip Werner, a co-organizer with the random group, will be making this summer.

Philip is a dynamic outdoor adventure speaker and photographer with over 20 years of public speaking experience to audiences of all a sizes. His past talks have covered hiking and winter mountaineering in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, Hiking the Appalachian Trail and Vermont’s Long Trail, Backpacking Coast-to-Coast across Scotland, Gear Demonstrations on Lightweight and Ultralight Backpacking, and Backpacking for Boy Scouts..

=====

  • October 20, 2011, An Introduction to Ultralight Backpacking, 6:00 p.m. – 7:30 p.m, EMS Harvard Square, 1 Brattle Street, 2nd Floor, Cambridge, MA 02138. Call (617) 864-2061 for more information. Attendance is Free.

    If you've ever been backpacking, you've probably heard people boast that their pack weighs 50 or 60 lbs. Those days are over. With a little knowledge and careful gear selection, it is possible for anyone to reduce their pack weight to a comfortable 20 or 25 lbs, even for a week long trip. By carrying less weight in your pack, you can hike further, see more, experience less fatigue, and prevent injuries. In this talk, Philip Werner will discuss a number of different strategies for reducing your gear weight and demonstrate some of the cutting edge gear used by lightweight and ultralight hikers, including products from leading manufacturers, both small and large, that are leaders in the lightweight backpacking revolution.
item.name: An Introduction to Ultralight Backpacking (Educational Series)
